page.title: 06LEWES PRISON
page.content: The{Prison}was built in{1853,}but the court was built some time in the{ {1800's}we don't quite know when.It cost{Â£55,000}to build the prison. The last person to be sentenced to death at the court was in{1963.}we interveiwed a{Judge}from the court his name was{Judge Gower}he is a circuit Judge.He said that he had once dozed off in court!We interviewed a{Mr {Bagnel}from the prison.In{Lewes Prison there are three wings, wing "A" for prisoners aged 17-21, wing"F" for adult local remandees and wing"C" which holds the long term sentenced prisoners. {Lewes prison}is situated at the Western end of Lewes at the edge of the Downs,but the court is in the High Street opposite the White Hart. By Penny T Emma A and Trista T.
